meanings.sent1: The vaned windmill spun gracefully in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The vaned airplane soared through the sky effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The vaned weather vane decided to take a day off and point in random directions.
meanings.sent4: Her vaned thoughts fluttered in different directions like a weathervane in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The vaned feathers of the bird shimmered in the sunlight, creating a beautiful display.

meanings.sent1: The vaned propeller on the boat helped it move smoothly through the water.
meanings.sent2: The vaned tail of the kite caught the wind and lifted it high into the air.
meanings.sent3: The vaned compass needle kept spinning in circles, confusing the hikers.
meanings.sent4: His vaned hair stood up straight in the wind, resembling a weather vane.
meanings.sent5: The vaned leaves on the tree rustled as the wind passed through, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: Furnished with a vane or vanes
meanings.sent1: The vaned weathercock on the barn indicated the direction of the wind.
meanings.sent2: The vaned wind turbine generated electricity for the entire town.
meanings.sent3: The vaned ceiling fan in the room spun so fast it created a mini breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her vaned umbrella turned inside out in the strong wind, resembling a weather vane.
meanings.sent5: The vaned sail on the boat billowed out as the wind caught it, propelling the vessel forward.
